name: More Than Words Journey Sock Yarn
description:
This special yarn is a tight 2ply of soft and squishy superwash merino wool blended with nylon for durability. It showcases stitch definition beautifully, and wears exceptionally well. It would be perfect for socks, shawls, baby knits, or holiday knitting. This is a brand-new colorway that is part of my Easy Listening Collection called More Than Words: a lovely gunmetal gray base with blue, gold, orange, and brick red in a kettle dyed colorway. This is a kettle dyed colorway and should not pool when knit. There are two skeins available in this dyelot. Treat yourself today!

400yds/100g
80% superwash merino wool/20% nylon
7-8 sts=1" on #1-3 needles
hand or machine wash cool, lay flat

After dyeing, I always rinse my items once in cool water; be aware that some dye leakage may still happen when the item is washed for the first time, but is not indicative of color fading.

Any purchase of 2 or more mailable items from my shop will receive an organic lavender sachet in their package. If you would prefer not to receive a sachet for allergy or other reasons, please leave me a note.

Please keep in mind that I try my best to photograph my items carefully, and that the colors are correct on my monitor.... however, there might be a slight variation between my monitor and yours.

TN residents will be charged 9.25% sales tax.

name: Broken Arrow Touring DK Yarn
description:
This yarn is a lovely 4ply dk weight yarn, made out of soft and squishy 100% superwash merino wool. I test knit all yarns before adding them to my line, and I honestly think that this is the best DK weight yarn on the market right now. It showcases both lace and cables beautifully when knit, and holds its shape with blocking and wearing. This is a brand new colorway for my new Easy Listening colorway collection that I'm calling Broken Arrow (named for the Rod Stewart song): a silver underdye with an overdye of orange and gold. It is a lovely autumnal yarn that is unisex. This is a kettle dyed yarn and should not pool when knit. There is only one skein in this dyelot. Treat yourself today: you'll be so glad you did!

100% superwash merino wool
231yds/100g
5.25-6 sts = 1" on US 5-7 needles
machine or hand wash in cool water, dry flat away from sun

After dyeing, I always rinse my items once in cool water; be aware that some dye leakage may still happen when the item is washed for the first time, but is not indicative of color fading.

name: First Frost Voyage Aran Yarn
description:
This yarn is a lovely squishy 3ply aran weight made from wonderful 100% British bluefaced leicester wool. Because it is a 3ply yarn, it is very round and shows stitch definition beautifully. It is non-superwash, so it would be perfect for felting, and if you like to make diaper soakers, it is definitely the yarn for you! It is also in generously-sized hanks, so one of these would be enough to make an accessory! This yarn has been dyed in a new colorway called First Frost: a silvery gray base with an aqua and avocado green wash. This is a kettle dyed yarn and should not pool when knit. There are four skeins available in this dyelot. Treat yourself today!

183yds/100g
100% British bluefaced leicester wool
4-5 sts = 1" on US 7-9 needles
hand wash cool, dry flat

description:

name: Kaleidoscope Microbatts Set 11 3.4oz 97g
description:
Kaleidoscope Microbatts are a new item in the shop, and I hope you love them! These are a smaller and more random version of my regular Kaleidoscope batts. They don’t have a set list of ingredients, but will never contain alpaca, mohair, or angora (because I have allergies, and I know a lot of you do too!), and may or may not contain sparkle. The color blending is also much more random and will produce a very tweedy yarn in most instances. They’re nonrepeatable, so if you see a set you like, snap it up!

name: Arabian Nights Journey Sock Yarn
description:
This special yarn is a tight 2ply of soft and squishy superwash merino wool blended with nylon for durability. It showcases stitch definition beautifully, and wears exceptionally well. It would be perfect for socks, shawls, baby knits, or holiday knitting. It has been space-dyed in my repeatable colorway Arabian Nights, which features colors of royal purple, reddish brown, gray, and bright clear orange. name: Faded Graffiti Lot 30 Skein 3 Touring DK Yarn
description:
In the downtown area here in Chattanooga, there are some awesome examples of graffiti. I especially love photographing graffiti (my other passion, besides fiber arts!) and this yarn was inspired by some of the photographs I've taken of old, fading graffiti. I start with dyeing my base yarn gray, then adding lots of colors over it in a wash. Since I dye many skeins in one pot, and add the colors randomly, no two skeins of this yarn will be exactly alike. If you need more than one skein of this yarn for a project, your best bet is to buy multiple skeins from the same lot, or contact me for a custom listing so I can get them as close as possible for you.

There is just one skein available in this dyelot. Treat yourself today!!

name: Aurora Borealis Portuguese Merino Spinning Fiber 118g 4.2oz
description:
This is the most economical base I carry. It is not as soft and silky as regular merino, but still has a really nice hand and is very poofy! You should give it a try! It would be especially great for new spinners, as it is a bit “grabbier” than regular merino, but is not as coarse as Corriedale. It also has a bit more veggie matter (or "VM") in it than my regular rovings do (although not as much as farm wools do), but it isn't so excessive that it will be a pain to spin. Most of it should fall out on its own as you draft. This particular braid has been dyed in my repeatable colorway Aurora Borealis, which features shades of purple, aqua, teal, olive, and chestnut that mimic the lovely colors of the northern lights. It will spin up into a variegated yarn. Treat yourself today!

100% Portugese Merino wool

name: Driving to SAFF Corriedale Cross Spinning Fiber 112g 4.0oz
description:
Corriedale Cross is a medium-bodied wool that is excellent for beginning spinners, but is also loved by more advanced spinners too! It is easily handled, drafts easily, and isn't too slippery. It withstands abrasion when spun and plied tightly so it is ideal for gloves, mittens, and socks, but it is also great for felting- just add a lot of agitation and hot water! This fiber has been dyed in my repeatable colorway Driving to SAFF: shades of a gold, orange, red, and brown. It will spin up into a variegated yarn. name: Panda Spin Your Own Socks Kit: Labradorite with Aqua
description:
I have paired 4oz of my Panda Sock Roving dyed in a main color with a 2oz coordinating color braid (in this case, Labradorite with Aqua) so you can spin your own sock yarn! This fiber can be spun in a variety of ways... some ideas:
* split the main braid in half and spin two singles, then spin the coordinating braid as a single, and do a tweedy 3ply
* spin the main braid and navajo ply (or three ply), and spin the coordinating braid for heels and toes
* or for a REALLY COOL idea: use the kit to spin for a shawl with a coordinating color edging!

Some information about Panda Sock Roving:
It is a wonderful mix of superwash merino, bamboo rayon, and nylon, so it is hardwearing and would be perfect to spin for socks! It is also soft and extremely smooth, with a gorgeous luster. 

The colorways featured here:
Labradorite:  shades of turquoise, ocean blue, olive, tan, and dark brown, and practically shimmers with luminescence just like the semiprecious stone it's named for.
Aqua: a gorgeous semisolid aqua blue.

60% superwash merino/30% bamboo rayon/10% nylon 
~4oz of main color, ~2oz of coordinating color for a total of ~6oz in the kit
hand or machine wash gentle, dry flat away from sun

After dyeing, I always rinse my items once in cool water; be aware that some dye leakage may still happen when the item is washed for the first time, but is not indicative of color fading.
